body:
DoJSToNumberOrNumericTruncatesToFloat64 and DoJSToNumberOrNumericTruncatesToWord32 (simplified-lowering.cc):

- Both functions lower JSToNumber / JSToNumeric into branches that first check ObjectIsSmi and convert via ChangeTaggedSignedToInt32 and ChangeInt32ToFloat64 (or TruncateFloat64ToWord32), else call ToNumber/ToNumeric builtin stub and then handle HeapNumber vs Smi cases in returns.
- They create Branch(BranchSemantics::kMachine) on ObjectIsSmi, build IfTrue/IfFalse subgraphs, and create Merge + EffectPhi + Phi nodes assembling final Float64 or Word32 value.
- They update exceptional call IfException uses to point to stub call node.
- Finally they replace control/effect uses of original node and DeferReplacement with the new value Phi.

Key lines: simplified-lowering.cc section 2 lines ~3180-3265 (Float64) and ~3266-3340 (Word32).

Why relevant: This defines how ToNumber conversions are lowered when truncations indicate Float64 or Word32 outputs; crucial for minus-zero behavior since Smi conversions treat -0 specially and stub calls can produce HeapNumber values (with -0) which are handled by subsequent checks (ObjectIsSmi) and Float64 conversions.

FileLine: compiler/simplified-lowering.cc: DoJSToNumberOrNumericTruncatesToFloat64 & DoJSToNumberOrNumericTruncatesToWord32 implementations (~3180-3340).
explanation: Captures the lowering of JSToNumber/JSToNumeric to machine-level branches and how Smi/HeapNumber are handled, showing the points where -0 can enter the lowered graph (HeapNumber loads).
